content: Investments ETF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 Apr 2019Any non SG ETFs to recommend?Thought of diversifying my portfolio globally, however still looking to purchase ETFs. Anyone has bought overseas ETFs before?3 answersAnswerBump0

Arpita MukherjeeLevel 2. RookieAnswered 5d agoAlbeit there are many non-Singapore ETFs that you can choose from, at Kristal.AI, we have Katalyst.Katalyst which is an actively managed kristal that identifies suitable ETFs across different sectors in the industry and invests to maximize returns while protecting the downside.Â Just so you know, we characterize different strategies as kristals. The Kristal invests to take tactical positions at a more targeted level than traditional style-based investing. It enables investors to acquire a low-cost exposure to popular, growing sectors like technology, healthcare, industrials, consumer discretionary that have been characterised by their solid balance sheets and extraordinary earnings growth. To reap the benefits of some diversification, this kristal also takes some exposure in emerging markets, while any remaining cash is kept invested in short term US treasuries.I work at Kristal.AI, and my mojo is to help people make the right financial decisions. If you think I helped you, do give me "Thumbs up". If you think my response was biased let me know, I will work on it.0 comments0

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 24 Apr 2019May not be a good time to get into ETFs now, especially if you believe the rumours about a recession coming. But if you want to go the ETF route, consider using robo advisories instead. A portfolio will be recommended based on your risk profile0 comments0

Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Hello!One of the more famous and well-known etfs outside of Singapore would be the S&P 500 index. The S&P 500 index is a market-capitalization-weighted index of the 500 largest U.S. publicly traded companies.1 comment0
Jonathan Chia Guangrong24 Apr 2019There are a number of ETFs tracking the S&P500, with SPY being one of the most largest. https://www.etf.com/channels/sp-500-etfs
